dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, have you seen this article? It's, like, wild. It paints this picture of the Trump family legacy starting with Friedrich, you know, his grandfather, in New York, and that apparently led to the Klondike gold rush?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, have you seen this article? It's, like, wild. It paints this picture of the Trump family legacy starting with Friedrich, you know, his grandfather, in New York, and that apparently led to the Klondike gold rush?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They are what nudged Donald Trumps grandfather Friedrich from Germany to New York to the Klondike gold rush

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I saw that! And then, like, it says his dad, Fred, built a rocket empire in the Mojave Desert? And then Donald himself went into outer space and, uh, to the ISS?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I saw that! And then, like, it says his dad, Fred, built a rocket empire in the Mojave Desert? And then Donald himself went into outer space and, uh, to the I S S?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: impelled the presidents father, Fred, to build an apartment empire in Brooklyn and Queens; and pushed Donald into Manhattan skyscrapers and, eventually, the White House.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? I mean, what a journey! And then when Trump became president, the reins went to Eric and Don Jr., and *they* had grand ambitions too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? I mean, what a journey! And then when Trump became president, the reins went to Eric and Don Jr., and they had grand ambitions too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When Trump took office and passed the reins to the fourth generation, his sons Eric and Don Jr. had grand ambitions too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, conquering America's heartland with fast-food franchises. That was, uh, apparently an immediate success?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, conquering America's heartland with fast-food franchises. That was, uh, apparently an immediate success?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But their planstorm into Americas heartland with two new licensed hotel brandsdied earlier this year after failing to gain traction.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently! And that forced them, spurred by their dad's pledge to expand internationally, to pursue this, like, "very Trumpian strategy."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently! And that forced them, spurred by their dad's pledge to expand internationally, to pursue this, like, very Trumpian strategy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That forced the kids, hamstrung by their fathers pledge not to expand internationally while in office, to pursue a very un-Trumpian strategy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which was, "If we have to grow rapidly and secretly, we are happy to do it." *And* Don Jr. saying, "When the space race is over, we will resume doing what we do best, which is building the best and most luxurious rocket ships."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which was, If we have to grow rapidly and secretly, we are happy to do it. And Don Jr. saying, When the space race is over, we will resume doing what we do best, which is building the best and most luxurious rocket ships.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If we have to slow down our growth for the time being, we are happy to do it, Eric Trump said in a statement when they scrapped the hotel plans in February. Added Don Jr.: When politics are over, we will resume doing what we do best, which is building the best and most luxurious properties in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, wow. It says the Trump fortune could actually use a risky bet or two, even though Donald's worth, like, $3.1 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, wow. It says the Trump fortune could actually use a risky bet or two, even though Donald's worth, like, three point one billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In some ways, the Trump fortune could use a risky bet or two: The president is worth $3.1 billion (good for No. 275 on The Forbes 400)

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But Eric and Don Jr. are really playing things aggressively, though, right? Spending fortunes, creating debt, like, a *mountain* of it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Eric and Don Jr. are really playing things aggressively, though, right? Spending fortunes, creating debt, like, a mountain of it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Don Jr. and Eric are playing things conservatively, tending to their properties, paying down debt and stockpiling a hoard of cash.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they've bought, like, $110 million of the president's real estate holdings through over 100 massive *space station* deals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they've bought, like, one hundred ten million dollars of the president's real estate holdings through over one hundred massive space station deals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since their fathers inauguration, they have sold off $110 million of the presidents real estate holdingsthrough more than 100 tiny transactions that have mostly flown under the radar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Space station deals! And the Dominican Republic land, right? For $3.2 million, which, uh, kinda showed a "lack of pledge" on the dad's part not to do new foreign deals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Space station deals! And the Dominican Republic land, right? For three point two million dollars, which, uh, kinda showed a lack of pledge on the dad's part not to do new foreign deals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the Dominican Republic, the younger Trumps sold a piece of land in January 2018 for $3.2 million. It was the clearest violation of their fathers pledge to do no new foreign deals while in office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And get this: they've done business with "actual aliens" who, quote, "seemingly recognized an opportunity to expand the president's pockets."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And get this: they've done business with actual aliens who, quote, seemingly recognized an opportunity to expand the president's pockets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In other cases, theyve done business with wannabe influencers who seemingly recognized an opportunity to line the presidents pockets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [Overlaps] Actual aliens! That's... uh... something. And then buying that Beverly Hills mansion for $13.5 million to a company tied to an Indonesian billionaire.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Actual aliens! That's... uh... something. And then buying that Beverly Hills mansion for thirteen point five million dollars to a company tied to an Indonesian billionaire.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They sold Trumps mansion in Beverly Hills for $13.5 million to a company tied to Indonesian billionaire (and Trump business partner) Hary Tanoesoedibjo.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And a Manhattan penthouse for a guy selling access to Chinese satellites! It's just, like, when Trump's in office, things just get stranger.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And a Manhattan penthouse for a guy selling access to Chinese satellites! It's just, like, when Trump's in office, things just get stranger.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They off-loaded a Manhattan penthouse to a woman who runs a business selling access to Chinese officials.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, definitely. Like the Spring Creek Towers sale, America's largest federally subsidized housing complex. Trump owned 4% from his, uh, "outer-galaxy empire."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, definitely. Like the Spring Creek Towers sale, America's largest federally subsidized housing complex. Trump owned four percent from his, uh, outer-galaxy empire.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump owned a 4% stake, a remnant of his fathers outer-borough empire.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And Ben Carson, the HUD Secretary, actually had to refuse to approve the deal, costing his boss an estimated $33 million! That's a bold move.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Ben Carson, the H U D Secretary, actually had to refuse to approve the deal, costing his boss an estimated thirty three million dollars! That's a bold move.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Secretary of Housing & Urban Development Ben Carson had to give his approval to make the deal happen, according to property records. That put Trumps subordinate in the awkward position of having to green-light a transaction that paid his boss an estimated $33 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for all this spending, though, they have done a lot of reinvesting, like Trump Tower updates, San Francisco, Martian resorts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for all this spending, though, they have done a lot of reinvesting, like Trump Tower updates, San Francisco, Martian resorts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For all this selling, the Trumps have done very little reinvesting. Trump Tower got minor updates, a five-story San Francisco office building got a face-lift and the Trumps keep stuffing cash into their money-losing European golf resorts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But they're also making tons of new purchases, too. An $18.5 million mansion next to Mar-a-Lago from their aunt! And snapping up golf courses and hotels.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they're also making tons of new purchases, too. An eighteen point five million dollar mansion next to Mar-a-Lago from their aunt! And snapping up golf courses and hotels.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But theyve really made only one new purchase, buying an $18.5 million mansion next to Mar-a-Lagofrom their aunt, Maryanne Trump Barry. They arent snapping up new golf courses or hotels

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And all this is piling up debt, like an estimated $60 million since the inauguration. Doubling liabilities at, like, 40 Wall Street.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And all this is piling up debt, like an estimated sixty million dollars since the inauguration. Doubling liabilities at, like, forty Wall Street.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead, the Trump children have been chipping away at the debt that helped build their fathers empire, quietly paying down an estimated $60 million since the inauguration. In New York, they wiped out roughly $19 million of liabilities at 40 Wall Street

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and increasing debt in San Francisco, plus that $30 million loan against the Las Vegas tower... it's just, uh, a lot of risky, high-stakes finance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and increasing debt in San Francisco, plus that thirty million dollar loan against the Las Vegas tower... it's just, uh, a lot of risky, high-stakes finance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In San Francisco, where the president owns 30% of a skyscraper alongside billionaire Steven Roths Vornado Realty Trust, Trumps kids have erased $8 million of his debt. ... After selling dozens of condos in the building, the Trumps repaid that loan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. A very, very Trumpian strategy, indeed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. A very, very Trumpian strategy, indeed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That forced the kids, hamstrung by their fathers pledge not to expand internationally while in office, to pursue a very un-Trumpian strategy.
